Description: Buff-coloured pottery ostracon, fragment from the body of a large vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with slip and with remains of eighteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded in places.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.99, pl.69)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82766) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82766)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alan Henderson Gardiner
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 69:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
